bibl.title: In the Matter of the Application of Flora Ohler for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: Third Judicial District Court of Nebraska

div1.p: 25-83 IN RE APPLICATION FLORA OHLER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

PLEAS: Before the Honorable Albert Cornish, Judge of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Nebraska, in and for the County of Lancaster: At the May, A.D. 1898, term of said Court, begun and held in the City of Lincoln, in said County and State, on the 2nd day of May, in the Year of Our Lord One Thousand One Hundred and Ninety Eight, and on a day therein, to-wit: On the 19th day of May, A.D. 1898, (that being the 16th Judicial Day of said May, A.D. 1898term of said Court) Present: Honorable Albert J Cornish, Judge Presiding, John J Trompen, Sheriff, and Sam E Low, Clerk: The following proceedings, among others, were had and done, to-wit:

BE IT REMEMBERED, that at several times hereinafter set forth were filed in the Office of the Clerk of said Court, papers, of which the following are true and correct copies, and proceedings were had and done in the cause below nbamed as follows, before the Honorable Albert J Cornish, Judge Presiding, to-wit:
PETITION. IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF LANCASTER COUNTY, NEBRASKA.
In the Matter of the Application ) of Flora Ohler for a writ of ) PETITION. Habeas Corpus. )

Your petitioner, Flora Ohler, respectfully represents to A.J. Cornish of the Judge of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Nebraska, that one Naomi A. Gielday is unlawfully deprived of her liberty by one Charles Shasfer in Red Willow County in this State; that your petitioner further represents that she is the mother of Naomi A. Gielday; that one Joseph S. Gielday was the father of said Naomi A. Gielday, and is now deceased. That the said Naomi A. Gielday is a minor 14 years of age. Your petitioner further represents to the court that by a decree of the District Court of Lancaster County, Nebraska, rendered on the 30th day of January, 1893, she was given the absolute and exclusive care, custody, nurture and education of said Naomi A. Gielday. That said decree is still in full force and effect, and has at no time been appealed from, vacated, or in any way modified.

Your petitioner further represents that said Charles Shafer, by fraud and deceit, enticed said Naomi A. Gielday to his residence, and now forcibly and unlawfully and against her will and against the will of your petitioner detains and deprives her of her liberty, in violation of said decree of said District Court of Lancaster County, and against the will, and without the consent of your petitioner, who is the mother of said child, and forcibly detains and refuses your petitioner the custody of said
23-85 IN RE APPLICATION FLORA OHLER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

Your petitioner further shows to the Court that the said Cjarles Shafer is not at this time a sheriff, deputy sheriff, coroner, constable, marshal of the state, nor marshal of the United States, or any officer of any court of the state or United States, and has no process or authority issued from any Court by which he detains and deprives said Naomi A. Gielday of her liberty.

Your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be issued, and that said Naomi A. Gielday may be discharged from said unlawful imprisonment, and placed in the custody of your petitioner, her mother. Flora Ohler
The State of Nebraska, ) :-SS. Furnas County, )
I, Flora Ohler, petitioner herein, do solemnly swear that the facts stated in the forgeoing petition are true as I verily believe.
Flora Ohler Subscribed in my presence and sworn to before me this 28th day of April, A.D. 1898. C E V. Smith Notary Public.
